answers.answer: Have you had any tests done for peripheral artery disease?  I have PAD and had my iliac artery stented.  I walked around with the pain in my leg for 2 years shrugging it off as arthritis.  It got to the point where it was too painful to walk around the store or a mall. When the foot went numb I decided to have this checked out.  The doppler showed a problem with the blood flow.  My leg had actually shrunk.  It was 2 inches in diameter smaller than my right leg. The artery was 100% blocked and had been for a couple of years. It took the doctor 4 hours to finally get the stent in place.  The plaque had become so calcified it was hard to get the stent in. The doctor said at one point he thought he would have to do bypass. Just my experience.  Take care, Ally

question: what would cause my left big toe to be partial numb and lower leg pain i have heart condition as well as diabetes pain getting worse
